We Represent Injury Victims Of Gunshot Accidents

Many gun tragedies are the result of accidents that were waiting to happen. Gun owners have a duty to store weapons and ammunition securely — but many don’t, and this results in the tragic loss of life.

Common Instances That Often Result In Tragedy

Common examples of gun owner negligence include:

  • Failure to put trigger, chamber or cable locks on guns
  • Failure to store ammunition securely
  • Accidental discharge of a weapon
  • Discharge of a weapon in a city or public area
  • Negligent handling of a weapon around others

Sadly, many victims of gunshot accidents are children. Neighbors are also commonly hit when gun owners discharge weapons carelessly.

Holding Negligent Gun Owners Accountable

Gun handlers have a duty to treat firearms as if they are capable of being discharged at any time. When careless people put others at risk, they need to be held accountable.

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, our law firm has a 50-year tradition of representing injured people and the families of wrongful death victims in Columbus and throughout Ohio.

If you were shot and injured or lost a loved one in a fatal shooting, you may have a legal claim against the gun’s owner or handler. If our lawyers feel that the gun’s owner or handler was negligent, we will spend the time and resources it takes to obtain the compensation you deserve.

We Advocate For Victims Of Gun Accidents Involving Neighbors Or Playmates

Gun accidents are devastating and can occur in the least suspecting environments. It is critical to take immediate legal action if you or a loved one is shot, as this may be a life or death scenario.

Please call 614-360-2706 today to schedule a consultation with one of our experienced attorneys. You may also contact us online.

We offer free consultations. Find out how we can help you.
